in_favor: Global primary energy intensity improved from 4.9 megajoules per dollar in 2015 to 4.6 in 2021.
Annual improvements must now average around 4 percent to meet the Goal 7 energy efficiency target by 2030.
International public financial flows for clean energy rebounded in 2022 but remain insufficient
against: The rate has remained under the 1.2 percent average observed during the last five years.
High interest rates pose a challenge as financing new projects has become more expensive, particularly in emerging markets and developing economies.
